definition: Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
Ludwigshafen am Rhein, German city on the Rhine opposite Mannheim
(bird species of China) Ludlow's fulvetta (Fulvetta ludlowi)
Martin Luther (1483-1546), key figure of the Protestant Reformation
Martin Luther King, Jr. (1929-1968), American clergyman and civil rights activist

sentences.english: Ludwig evidently sees evidence of child abuse.
sentences.chinese: 路德維希顯然看到了虐待兒童的蛛絲馬跡。
佔統治地位的宗教是路德教會。

sentences.english: The principle, "Scripture Interprets Scripture" is unique to the Lutheran church.
sentences.chinese: 對於路德宗教會來說，“以經解經”的原則是唯一的。

sentences.english: Swedenborg was the son of a devout bishop of the Lutheran Church in Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 威登是兒子，一個虔誠的主教的路德教會在瑞典。

sentences.english: A 10-meter high sculpture of King is carved from the center piece.
sentences.chinese: 馬丁路德金10米高的塑像，就雕在花崗石的中間。

sentences.english: When I woke, Luda once several times called me as Chau Jie.
sentences.chinese: 記起當我醒來時，路德曾數次稱我爲橋傑。

sentences.english: Is it Martin Luther King's dream?
Martin Luther was born in 1483 at Eisleben, Saxony, Germany.
sentences.chinese: 1483年馬丁路德出生於德國，薩克森，艾斯萊本。

sentences.english: Luther broad range of activities in China.
sentences.chinese: 路德宗在中國活動範圍甚廣。

sentences.english: King Ludwig didn't get much chance to enjoy the over-the-top Neuschwanstein.
sentences.chinese: 路德維希國王沒有得到多少機會享受新天鵝堡。

sentences.english: Lude also once wrong declared me Qiao Jie for several times.
sentences.chinese: 橋傑教授？路德也曾數次錯口稱我橋傑。

sentences.english: The hill is supposed to be the resting place of the legendary King Lud.
sentences.chinese: 這座山據說是傳說中的路德國王休息的地方。

sentences.english: There is no single date that marks the birth of the Lutheran Churches.
sentences.chinese: 沒有一個日期標誌着路德派教會們的誕生。

sentences.english: Martin Luther King Jr. died with no more than one half of his dreams fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 馬丁路德金帶着僅完成一半的夢想溘然辭世。

sentences.english: Forty-seven years ago Martin Luther King had a lecture named I have a dream .
sentences.chinese: 47年前馬丁路德金有一個名爲我有一個夢想的演講。

definition: Martin Luther (1483-1546), key figure of the Protestant Reformation
